trans-unit.source: Represents a complex shape that may be composed of arcs, curves, ellipses, lines, and rectangles.
Each PathGeometry object defines a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> objects.

Each of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> objects is composed of one or more <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathSegment> objects, such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.ArcSegment> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.LineSegment>, which actually define their shape.

The filled area of the PathGeometry is defined by taking all of the contained <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> objects that have their <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure.IsFilled%2A> property set to `true` and applying the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.FillRule%2A> to determine the enclosed area.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> class with the specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.Figures*>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.Figures*> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> which describes the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Shapes.Path"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> class with the specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.Figures*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.FillRule*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry.Transform*>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.Figures*> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> which describes the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Shapes.Path"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.FillRule*> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry.Transform*> which specifies the transform applied.
Converts the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> into a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathFigure"></xref> objects and adds it to the path.

**Note:** If the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> is animated, the conversion from <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> to <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathFigure"></xref> may result in some loss of information.
The geometry to add to the path.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that specifies the bounding box of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> object.
**Note:** This method does not take any pens into account.
If animations are present, the base values of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> object are used to calculate the bounding box.
The bounding box of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref>.
Removes all <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathFigure"></xref> objects from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref>.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> version of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref>.
If the specified geometry is animated, its current animated values are used when constructing the new <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry> (although the animations themselves are not copied).
If the geometry is animated, the conversion may result in some loss of precision.
The geometry from which to create a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> created from the current values of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref>.
To be added.
Gets or sets the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathFigure"></xref> objects that describe the path's contents.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *moveAndDrawCommands* One or more move and draw commands.
See [Path Markup Syntax](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
*oneOrMoreFigures* <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure?displayProperty=fullName> One or more <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathFigure> objects.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathFigure"></xref> objects that describe the path's contents.
Each individual <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathFigure"></xref> describes a shape.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.Figures*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that determines how the intersecting areas contained in this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> are combined.

**EvenOdd** Determines the "insideness" of a point on the shape by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses.
If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

**NonZero** Determines the "insideness" of a point on the shape by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.
Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a Segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left.
After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path.
Otherwise, it is inside.

![Fill rule illustration](~/add/media/ref-mil-fillrule-stars.PNG "Fill rule illustration") FillRule Example ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
Indicates how the intersecting areas of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> are combined.
The default value is `EvenOdd`.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.FillRule*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> and a tangent vector on this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> at the specified fraction of its length.
The fraction of the length of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref>.
When this method returns, contains the location on this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> at the specified fraction of its length.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
When this method returns, contains the tangent vector.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> object is empty.
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> is empty; otherwise, **false**.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> object may have curved segments.
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry"></xref> object may have curved segments; otherwise, **false**.
